ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about Sculpture and what makes a sculpture unique. I didn't realize before this class what a wide variety of types of art fall under sculpture.
I learned so many sculpture techniques throughout the semester. I also learned how to look at art and appreciate it more.

I have an interest in minimalist and calculative sculpture. I knew that I am not talented when it comes to 2D art, but 3D art is very satisfying and this course was well-suited to let me explore. The initial prompt was a challenge in and of itself, as finding a reasonable object (i.e. no couches, fences, or giant Panasonic TVs) that spoke to me proved difficult. This course also pushed me to manage my time as efficiently as possible, as coming in outside of class hours needed to be incorporated into my routine.
Skills with specific materials and sculpture studio experience
I got to know more about different materials and what it meant to construct something from scratch/from found objects.
I gained an appreciation for sculpture and how to use a bunch of different materials.
I learned so much! This course made me think very differently and use my head in new ways. I learned about mold making, woodworking, spatial awareness, and creative thinking.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: We got to do what we wanted to using different materials and techniques that were shown to us. Weakness: I wish we could have worked on more projects. This was due to many absences because of Covid.

All weaknesses are due to the course's reintroduction post-quarantine phases. The pace had to be manageable for each student, so we really only worked through two projects. I wish I could have done more, but we all had to be patient.
Good crit structure and class vibes and organization

Strengths: Sandra and my TA Pap were both so supportive of all of my classmates and I genuinely just got to play around and explore, which was the best part of this class. All of my classmates and I got so close to each other, Sandra, and Pap which was so fun, in addition to being able to flex a different part of my brain. 

Weaknesses: only got to do about 2 projects, but that had more to do with COVID and absences due to COVID than anything else.
I loved how we were given free-reign on our projects and could explore in a really open-ended way. I found that to be a really fruitful way to understand my own voice

A strength is the teacher- Sandra is incredible. Another strength is having the classroom workspace available. It is so, so nice to have somewhere that is the classs to work in and leave projects in.
A weakness might be that some students were aware of how flexible and kind our teacher was, and didnt put in an amount of effort that added to the environment.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! Sandra is amazing and this class is so fun. It is rare to do hands-on projects in college. This is the most fun and interesting class I have ever taken at yale.

If you can take this course with Sandra, take it! You will learn so much so quickly and it is also a way to disconnect from any other classes that you are taking. Even if you are not an art major, TAKE THIS COURSE. Could not recommend it enough.

Yes, I believe Sandra provided an environment in which I felt safe to learn, ask questions and make mistakes. Sandra was extremely flexible with deadlines due to Covid. She allowed us to experiment with our works and try new things.I thoroughly enjoyed Sandras class and I hope to take an intermediate version in the future!
yes, good for all levels of art skill

Absolutely, if you are willing to step out of your comfort zone and stay after class/come outside of class to work on your projects. If you are someone who doesn't enjoy building/creating things with your hands and would rather be writing papers, do not take this class.
Yes!
Yes! This was an incredible course and I loved taking it. I learned a lot of got to try so many new things. Amazing!
